name: The Homemade Pantry's Coffee Liqueur
description: Coffee liqueur—a given for Irish Coffees and White Russians, but not too much else—is not the most serious of drinks. But that is precisely why Alana Chernila's recipe for Coffee Liqueur from The Homemade Pantry is genius.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the water, sugar, and instant coffee in a large saucepan and bring to a high simmer, but not a boil. Cover and cook for 1 hour, taking care that it continues to simmer without coming to a boil.

Let the mixture cool and add the vodka, stirring to combine. Transfer to a bottle or jar, add the vanilla beans, screw on the lid, and keep in a cool, dark place for at least 2 weeks before serving (though it will taste even better as time passes).
